input:

He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one! 42:04 Caption: Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the roof of the net. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save! The ball goes behind for a corner. Bayern Munich will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
42:29 Event: Corner by Bayern Munich
42:34 Event: Shots on target by Bayern Munich

43:16 Event: Goal by Bayern Munich
43:42 Caption: David Alaba (Bayern Munich) scores a splendid goal as he finishes his great individual effort with a venomous shot from around 18 metres out into the top right corner. Take a bow son. The score is now 3:0.

46:59 Caption: The fans must be pleased so far with the entertainment on the pitch. Let's hope the players don't lose their passion and determination during the half-time break. It was a fairly one-sided opening 45 minutes, with Bayern Munich much the better side better so far. The home team tries to prevail using combination football, while the away team adopt a defensive style of play.

Bayern Munich were dominant and more threatening of the two sides. It was a fairly one-sided match. It was obvious that the hosts tried to outplay their opponents with some passing football, while the visitors focused on counter-attacking play.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Bayern Munich triumphed over Arsenal with a resounding 5-1 victory at the Allianz Arena in a Champions League group stage clash. The game was a display of sheer dominance by the German champions, who showed their quality in both halves of the match.

The game kicked off with Arsenal in possession, keen to set the tempo early on. Within the first 22 seconds, Arsenal showed their intent with a shot, albeit off target. The ball soon went out of play. Bayern Munich immediately reacted with a clearance within the first minute, and it was clear that both teams were ready for a high-paced, competitive encounter.

The first ten minutes of the match saw back-and-forth play, with each side trying to gain control. Bayern Munich finally broke the deadlock at the 10-minute mark. Following a well-targeted shot which was superbly saved, Arsenal's brief moment of attacking glory was cut short when Gianluca Rocchi, the referee, disallowed Mesut Ozil's would-be goal due to a handball. This disallowed goal seemed to fuel Bayern's momentum.

Bayern Munich's pressure paid off beautifully with a goal in the 9th minute. They executed a well-coordinated attack that saw Thomas Muller in position to pick up a loose ball in the penalty box and fire it past Petr Cech, giving Bayern an early lead. Arsenal attempted to respond quickly, but their effort was stymied.

Arsenal continued to push forward, but their frustrations mounted when Mesut Ozil earned a yellow card for dissent after arguing with the referee. As the first half progressed, Bayern Munich started to control the game, utilizing their midfielders Thomas Muller and Xabi Alonso effectively. By the 16th minute, Bayern had already forced several saves out of Arsenal’s goalkeeper with dangerous shots.

In the 28th minute, Bayern's relentless pressure led to their second goal. Kingsley Coman had his shot blocked from inside the box, but the ball fell kindly to Thomas Muller who made no mistake from close range, doubling Bayern's advantage. Arsenal's defensive frailties were apparent, and they were struggling to cope with Bayern's fluid attacking play.

The rest of the first half continued in a similar vein. Arsenal found it difficult to break down Bayern’s defense, while the hosts kept creating chances. By the 36th minute, Bayern had another splendid opportunity. David Alaba produced a moment of brilliance with a stunning individual effort from around 18 meters out, beating Cech with a powerful strike into the top right corner. The score was now 3-0, and Bayern were cruising.

Arsenal managed to create a few opportunities but failed to convert any into goals. Bayern Munich held onto their lead till the half-time break with a commanding 3-0 scoreline.

The second half began with Bayern Munich picking up where they left off. A few minutes into the restart, Xabi Alonso tested Petr Cech from distance, earning Bayern a corner. The set-piece routines employed by Bayern Munich kept Arsenal’s defense on their toes. The hosts were not content with sitting back and defending their lead; they continued to push forward, maintaining possession and probing Arsenal’s defensive lines.

In the 9th minute of the second half, Bayern made a substitution, bringing on Arjen Robben for Coman. The Dutchman made an immediate impact, and within seconds of coming on, he found himself on the scoresheet. David Alaba found Robben with a precise pass inside the box, and the substitute made no mistake, firing into the roof of the net to make it 4-0.

Despite Arsenal's determined efforts, their attacks were often thwarted by Bayern’s solid defensive unit. Arsenal finally got a consolation goal in the 70th minute. Olivier Giroud received a wonderful lofted pass from Alexis Sanchez and finished with aplomb, beating Manuel Neuer with a well-placed shot into the middle of the goal.

Bayern Munich responded swiftly to Arsenal's goal. Their relentless attack continued, and in the 89th minute, Thomas Muller scored his second of the night, completing the rout. Douglas Costa provided the assist, and Muller finished clinically, placing the ball into the bottom right corner.

Bayern Munich’s possession statistics highlighted their dominance, with 66% to 34% possession in favor of the hosts. Despite several moments of bright attacking play from Arsenal, Bayern's defense stood firm, making key interceptions and clearances.

The final minutes of the game saw Bayern Munich managing the game effectively, ensuring there were no further defensive lapses. The referee's whistle brought an end to a comprehensive performance by Bayern Munich, sealing a 5-1 victory over Arsenal.

Overall, Bayern Munich was the far superior side, demonstrating brilliance in attack and solidity in defense. Arsenal's inability to capitalize on their chances and defensive mistakes ultimately cost them dearly. Bayern's combination play, passing accuracy, and clinical finishing were on full display, making it a night to remember for the Bavarians.

The game had it all—disallowed goals, spectacular saves, commanding midfield play, and clinical finishing. Players like Thomas Muller and Xabi Alonso were pivotal in maintaining Bayern's midfield dominance, and it was their coordination that orchestrated many of the German side's attacks. For Arsenal, it was a night of learning and development; despite showing glimpses of potential, they were outclassed by a Bayern side that was superior in every aspect of the game.

This decisive victory not only ensures Bayern Munich's place at the apex of their Champions League group but also sends a strong message to their European competitors. For Arsenal, it is back to the drawing board as they look to regroup and address the shortcomings that were exposed in this lopsided clash.
